SEARCH
Package com.github.alexisc183.jforconsol

Class InputRequest

java.lang.Object
com.github.alexisc183.jforconsol.InputRequest
public final class InputRequest extends Object
Requests of an input value to the user with the certainty of said value always being correct.

The purpose of this class is the same as JInputRequest. The major difference is that the InputRequest class fits those environments where GUIs cannot be rendered, like server-oriented operating systems. On the other hand the JInputRequest class is implemented with a Java Swing component, concretely a JOptionPane dialog.

The InputRequest class is implemented by using the Scanner class with the System.in field. Once any of the request methods of the InputRequest class is invoked, the Scanner class is instantiated and only once. This last operation means that at some point the Scanner instance must be closed. The InputRequest class provides a method for that.

Since:
JForconsol 1.0.0
Version:
1, 2025-05-30
Author:
AlexisC183

  • Method Details

    • isSkippable

      public static boolean isSkippable()
      Checks whether requests can be skipped by pressing Enter or not.
      Returns:
      true if requests can be skipped by pressing Enter; false otherwise.

    • setSkippable

      public static void setSkippable(boolean value)
      Sets whether requests can be skipped by pressing Enter or not depending on the provided value.
      Parameters:
      value - If true, pressing Enter won't result in an invalid requested input, otherwise will.

    • getErrorMessage

      public static String getErrorMessage()
      Returns the error message for the input request.
      Returns:
      the string that may be printed if the user enters an invalid input

    • setErrorMessage

      public static void setErrorMessage(String errorMessage)
      Sets the error message that may be printed if the user enters an invalid input.
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - the string that may be printed if the user enters an invalid input

    • getRequestMessage

      public static String getRequestMessage()
      Returns the request message for the input request.
      Returns:
      the string that is printed when requesting the input

    • setRequestMessage

      public static void setRequestMessage(String requestMessage)
      Sets the request message that is printed when requesting the input.
      Parameters:
      requestMessage - the string that is printed when requesting the input

    • request

      public static String request()
      Requests the input with no additional processing.
      Returns:
      a string of the input, or null if the request was skipped according to the isSkippable method
      See Also:
      • isSkippable()

    • request

      public static <T> T request(Parser<T> parseMethod)
      Requests the input and processes it with the provided conversion method.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to request
      Parameters:
      parseMethod - the method that converts a string to T
      Returns:
      a T from the converted input, or null if the request was skipped according to the isSkippable method
      See Also:
      • isSkippable()

    • request

      public static <T> T request(Parser<T> parseMethod, Predicate<T> condition)
      Requests the input and processes it with the provided conversion method and predicate.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the input to request
      Parameters:
      parseMethod - the method that converts a string to T
      condition - the predicate used to test the input
      Returns:
      a T from the converted input, or null if the request was skipped according to the isSkippable method
      See Also:
      • isSkippable()

    • close

      public static void close()
      Closes the Scanner associated with this class.

      Once this method is invoked, all of the request methods become unusable and throw an IllegalStateException regardless of whether the scanner was ever open.
